question: If <katex>$A$</katex> and <katex>$B$</katex> are two matrices such that <katex>$AB=B$</katex> and <katex>$BA=A$</katex> then <katex>$A^{2}+B^{2}=$</katex>
explanation: Consider <katex>$A^2 = A \cdot A = (BA)A = B(AA) = B(A^2)$</katex>. This path is circular.
Better approach: <katex>$A^2 = A \cdot A = (BA)A = B(AA)$</katex>. Alternatively, <katex>$A^2 = A(BA) = (AB)A = BA = A$</katex>.
Similarly, <katex>$B^2 = B \cdot B = (AB)B = A(BB)$</katex>. Alternatively, <katex>$B^2 = B(AB) = (BA)B = AB = B$</katex>.
